card1.title: Wall Structure
card1.desc:
Our ger wall: /FRP+XPS+FRP/ 5mm FRP panels on both sides, 9cm XPS foam insulation in the middle, total 10cm thickness.
FRP – Resists shock and mechanical impact well, but requires good foundation anchorage in very strong winds.
XPS Foam – Low heat loss, lightweight material, sufficient to support snow weight.

card2.title: Energy Saving Construction
card2.desc:
• High thermal insulation, resistant from +45°C to -45°C
• Lifespan: 50+ years
• Electricity: Simple connection, can also be connected to solar + wind sources and smart controls
• Usage: Suitable for Mongolia's extreme climate, tourism, and year-round use.

card3.title: Fast Construction
card3.desc:
"Smart Eco Ger" is built by assembling parts. Design: Traditional Mongolian ger design.
• Lifespan: 50+ years
• Portability: Modular, so 3-4 people can disassemble and assemble it by hand within 3-4 hours.
• Electricity: Simple connection, can also be connected to solar + wind sources and smart controls.

card1.title: Strong Wind Resistance
card1.desc:
The optimal shape of the "Smart Eco Ger" protects it from direct wind. The FRP wall surface is resistant to sand and dirt and does not crack.
Good sealing of the roof, door, and windows prevents dust from entering the interior. Resistant to winds of 20-30m/s.

card2.title: Smart Ventilation System
card2.desc:
1. Fresh air intake /skirting/ admits fresh, filtered air (with PM2.5 filter) from outside.
2. Solar-powered exhaust fan /mounted on toono/ expels hot, polluted air, humidity, and stale air through the toono.
Result: Indoor air is constantly renewed. Protects against overheating in summer, prevents condensation and moisture in winter. Creates a healthy, comfortable environment.

card3.title: Snow Load Capacity
card3.desc:
A 6m diameter ger can safely support an average of 70-100 cm of snow. If more snow falls, the roof needs to be shaken to clean it.
Also, our ger walls are slippery, so snow is less likely to stick.
XPS Foam – Low heat loss, lightweight material, sufficient to support snow weight.
